documentation.author: KNOWLEDGE & DISCOVERY
documentation.purpose: This rule provides an alert when any pharmacy order is placed or the patient's chart is accessed via phamedmgr, if the patient does not have height, weight or allergy information on file and recommends this information be added before allowing the order to exist. A powerform is attached to the alert for the user to immediately document the missing information.
documentation.explanation:
Medication decisions are based on the patient's height, weight and allergy information. If this information is not on file orders should be rejected and ordering personnel apprised of the need for this information.
Height, Weight and Allergy will be evaluated for all patients and ages that are not in the Emergency Department (Action Groups 1-7).
Patients over the age of 12 in the Emergency Department will only be evaluated for Allergies (Action Group 8)
Patients less than or equal to 12 in the Emergency Department will be evaluated for Weight and Allergies (Action Group 9-11).
documentation.impact:
Note: If you are on 2004.01code or higher, please delete the ADDTOSCRATCHPAD Evoke on, Template L2, the "OR" and both parentheses. If you are on a code level prior to 2004.01, please delete the OPENCHART Evoke on, Template L3, the "OR" and both parentheses.
Note: When/If templates are removed please verify that all substition values are correct.
Note: If OPENCHART is used, the EKS_APPLICATION_E and EKS_APPLICATION_L will need to be reinstantiated.
Note: Template L8 must be reinstantiated with all of the organizations Emergency Room locations.
Note: The PowerForm, Height and Weight, in the OPT_FORM paramater of the EKS_ALERT_FLEX_A template will be replaced by your organizations form that captures height, weight and allergy.
documentation.keywords: pharmacy order addtoscratchpad medication height weight allergy synchronous

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_APPLICATION_E
templateDefinitions.definition: The application being used QUALIFIER APPLICATION
templateDefinitions.description: Application that generated the evoking event

statements.statement: select Application_Name = ap.description, _hidden = ap.application_number from application ap where ap.active_ind = 1 /*and (ap.direct_access_ind = 1 or ap.application_number in (961000,600005,380000)) */ and ap.application_number > 0 and ap.description > " " order application_name

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_STOP_LOGIC_L
templateDefinitions.definition: the following templates are false, MODE logic evaluation
templateDefinitions.description: Used to control efficiency of Action Group rules

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_ORDER_INCOMING_DETAIL_L
templateDefinitions.definition: orders exist ORD_METHOD OPT_ORDERS where order detail ORDER_DETAIL QUALIFIER LIST1 and OPT_LIST2

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_APPLICATION_L
templateDefinitions.definition: The application being used QUALIFIER APPLICATION
templateDefinitions.description: Application that generated the evoking event

statements.statement: select Application_Name = ap.description, _hidden = ap.application_number from application ap where ap.active_ind = 1 /*and (ap.direct_access_ind = 1 or ap.application_number in (961000,600005,380000)) */ and ap.application_number > 0 and ap.description > " " order application_name

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_CE_RESULT_MOST_RECENT_L
templateDefinitions.definition: the most recent result for EVENT_SET_NAME is EVALUATION VALUE1 and OPT_VALUE2 for the same encounter as OPT_LINK over the last OPT_TIME_NUM OPT_TIME_UNIT

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_ALLERGY_FIND_L
templateDefinitions.definition: An allergy exists that ALLERGY_QUAL OPT_ALLERGY for OPT_CATEGORY category with reaction OPT_REACTION_QUAL OPT_REACTION and OPT_REACTION_TYPE, OPT_REACTION_STATUS, OPT_SEVERITY, OPT_INFO_SOURCE, OPT_CANCEL_REASON. Optionally narrow allergy matching by limiting cross-mapping to OPT_CROSS_VOCABS vocabularies OPT_PERSON_ACTIVITY concepts on patient’s profile and/or OPT_VOCAB_HIERARCHY hierarchy or ignoring concepts altogether OPT_IGNORE_CONCEPTS. Find all matches OPT_MATCH_ALL.

column.value: Including cross map patient activity data
Excluding cross map patient activity data

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_ENCOUNTER_LOC_DETAIL_L
templateDefinitions.definition: the patient's ENC_DETAIL that QUAL in DETAIL_VALUE for the same encounter as OPT_LINK

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_ALERT_FLEX_A
templateDefinitions.definition: Send alert OPT_TITLE stating TXT, OPT_CANCEL_LABEL, OPT_IGNORE_LABEL, OPT_OVERRIDE_REASON, OPT_MODIFY_LABEL, OPT_DEFAULT_LABEL, OPT_ORDERS, OPT_DEFAULT_FIRST_ORDER, OPT_URL_BUTTON_NAME, OPT_URL_ADDRESS, OK_BUTTON_NAME, OPT_FORM, OPT_FORM_BUTTON_NAME, OPT_FORCE_FORM, OPT_LINK

statements.statement: select distinct Form_Definition = if (t.seq = 1) dfr.definition else "*NONE" endif, _hidden = if (t.seq = 1) dfr.dcp_forms_ref_id else 0.0 endif, Description = if (t.seq = 1) dfr.description else "NONE" endif from dcp_forms_ref dfr, (dummyt t with seq=2) plan dfr where dfr.active_ind = 1 and textlen(trim(dfr.definition)) > 0 and textlen(trim(dfr.definition)) > 0 join t order Form_Definition

column.value: PowerPorm must be opened, dismiss Alert
PowerForm must be signed, dismiss Alert

values.value: BASELINE EAST M, BEMC, East ED
BASELINE WEST M, BWMC Acute Care, BW ED

customValue.value: 3440686 ^BASELINE WEST M, BWMC Acute Care, BW ED^3
3440686^BASELINE WEST M, BWMC Acute Care, BW ED^3
